summary: Convert armor to match your playstyle! Highly compatible, crafting menu clutter free! Now wear light versions of that kickass heavy armor!
descriptionHtml:
[center][color=Black]

[size=7]Convert Your Armor - Balanced Transmogrification[/size][/color]
[/center][center][color=Black][size=4]by Madcow[/size][/color][/center]
[color=Black][size=3]Version :[/size][/color]1.8
[color=Black][size=3]Date :[/size][/color]6/1/2014
[color=Black][size=3]Category :[/size][/color]Armor

[u][center][size=5][color=Black]Description[/color][/size][/center][/u]
This mod adds recipes for converting those heavy armor to light armor or clothing, and light to heavy or clothing. Nothing else is changed, only crafting and tempering recipes so you can use it with all them other crafting overhauls and armor retextures and custom armors out there! Now you can run around in that sexy steel armor...with light armor stats going up! Recommend to use with armor retexture mods.


Stats have been adjusted to reflect their new characteristics
So for instance, Ebony Heavy>Ebony Light>Glass Heavy>Glass Light
so the gaps might not seem so big but it's there and with tempering it'll grow


[u][center][size=5][color=Black]Detail[/color][/size][/center][/u]
General rule of conversion (You must have the original piece crafted first)
Light+3 Ingots = Heavy
Heavy+1 Ingot = Heavy/Light/Clothe
Light+1 Ingot= Clothe

-Convert light armor to heavy armor or clothing, or heavy armor to light armor or clothing all at the Forge. You can even convert back the converted armor! Except clothe. Once you convert it to cloth you can't change it back. I might add recipes later. Much later.
-Does not change but add in to vanilla levelled list! I think it should be very compatible. This means you will see light versions of the Iron Armor of Health
-Uses nothing but vanilla recipes. Load it early on to let other crafting modifiers have their effect!
-All armors are enchantable and lootable and upgradable
!!!Now comes with specific "Converter Anvils" used just for converting! Keep your crafting list clean and simple!!! Refer to image to what they look like.

[u][center][size=5][color=Black]Location[/color][/size][/center][/u]
Coverter Anvil Locations:
Riverwood
Whiterun (Warmaiden and Skyforge)
Solitude
Rorikstead
Karthwasten
Morthal
Falkreath
Winterhold
Windhelm
Dawnstar
Skaal Village
Raven Rock

[u][center][size=5][color=Black]History[/color][/size][/center][/u]
=====================
Below is the list of armors completed. Note that armors that already have light variants were not touched.
====================
Vanilla Armor: All Done (Some faction armors were not touched for lore)
Includes Dragon Priest Masks

Custom Armor:
R18Pn Eisen Platte
Hothtrooper44's Immersive Armors
asianboy345's TERA Armor
Frigus' TERA CBBE Armor

Awaiting Permission:
Zerofrost

[u][center][size=5][color=Black]Upgrade[/color][/size][/center][/u]
Simply replace the existing esp with the new one

[u][center][size=5][color=Black]Incompatibilities[/color][/size][/center][/u]
Compatible with:
SkyRe - Simply run the reproccer with this loaded above. The reproccer will take care of things.
Any Retexture mods
WIP - Custom Armors: Place requests in the Post section

Incompatible with:
Nothing I think. Textures are not touched which means they will correctly display whatever other texture you've installed on top
-The anvils have been placed carefully to not interfere with Navmesh or any town expanding mods. Please notify me of any conflicts


[u][center][size=5][color=Black]Contacts[/color][/size][/center][/u]
If you have any questions post under Post tab or PM me

[u][center][size=5][color=Black]Manual Installation[/color][/size][/center][/u]
Download and install via NMM or simply place the esp file in Skyrim/Data

[u][center][size=5][color=Black]Mod Dependencies[/color][/size][/center][/u]
Custom armor patches requires the original mods
WARNING: DO NOT USE THE TERA UNP PATCH WITH UNP CLOTHING MERCHANTS. The TERA UNP mod is compatible, but it will not work with UNP Clothing Merchants

[u][center][size=5][color=Black]Future Plans[/color][/size][/center][/u]
To-do list:
Addition of custom armor mods


[u][center][size=5][color=Black]Recommended Mods[/color][/size][/center][/u]
Killer Keos Skimpy Armor by Killer Keos
Remodeled Armor by Mak07
Amedianborn Book of Silence
Zerofrost's works
Immersive Armors v7

Try out my other mods:
Helmless Warrior Reworked (www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/54371/?)
Madcow's Race Enhancement (http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/54422/?)

[u][center][size=5][color=Black]Change log[/color][/size][/center][/u]
v1.7 Corrected keywords associated to armor
Eisen1.2 Corrected keywords and removed redundant recipes
IA 1.3 Corrected keywords, included missing recipes (IAConanOutfit)

Update#1: My deepest apologies to all the folks who tried out my mod. Thank you for the great words of compliment and criticism. I've been away from Skyrim for a long time, and I'm finally getting back to it. Which means I will also work out any errors or bugs and release a newer version soon enough. Thank you.
